New Records: Pete Alonso became the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run while trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all playoff game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run opposite-field line drive in the ninth inning
Devin Williams hit Jesse Winker with a fastball
Starling Marte singled to give New York a 4-2 lead
David Peterson induced a game-ending double play ball to Francisco Lindor
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' comeback victory in the decisive Game 3 gave them their first playoff series win since claiming the NL pennant in 2015.
New York will face the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS, marking the first time the two fierce rivals have ever met in the postseason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Every team to have eliminated the Brewers from the playoffs has gone on to reach the Fall Classic.
Game 1 of the NLDS between the Mets and Phillies starts at 4:08 p.m. ET on FOX and the FOX Sports App.
Others: The Mets went 6-7 against the Phillies during the regular season and finished six games behind them in the NL East standings.
